title: Union Square Points of Interest
name: Union Square Points of Interest
description:
A Map by Stevesinger

Walking distances to points of interest, bus routes, restaurants, playgrounds and more

properties.name: Full Moon Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Stevesinger 344 Huron Avenue, Cambridge, MAThis restaurant manages to be kid-friendly while still serving great food (from grilled salmont filet to mac n cheese). It is right across the street from a nice toy store too: Henry Bear\'s Park. www.fullmoonrestaurant.com 617 354 6699 Also check out there sing a-longs and Story Hours.

properties.name: Henry Bear's Park
properties.description: Posted by Stevesinger 361 Huron Ave, Cambridge, MAA great toy store complete with weekly, free, story hour. And it is across the street from Full Moon Restaurant, a place that manages to be kid friendly and still server great food. http://www.henrybear.com/ story hour on Thursdays at 11am

properties.name: Prospect Hill Playground
properties.description: Posted by Stevesinger  There\'s a fenced in playground complete with swing sets and sliding boards. The park across the street adjoins an old fort and offers a nice view of the Boston skyline. Just a short walk from 94 Summer Street.

properties.name: Somerville Family Network - Cummings School
properties.description: Posted by Stevesinger 42 Prescott Street, Somerville MALocated in the Cummings School - Room #14, Somerville Family Network is a flexible and collaborative agency working with families together to develop a connected system of services to help and support all parents within the community of Somerville. 617-625-6600 ext. 6990http://www.somerville.k12.ma.us/education/dept/dept.php?sectionid=57 Call or visit the web site for information on programs like playgroups, community events, and seminars.

properties.name: Somerville Library Playground
properties.description: Posted by Stevesinger  This playground is wooden and a little run down. Also, since it is near the highschool, some older kids hang out there as well. But it is very close to the library and good for a swing or two.

properties.name: Somerville Main Library
properties.description: Posted by Stevesinger79 Highland Avenue, Somerville, MAMore than just a place to borrow books, the library has a collection of movies, a great kids collection and reading area, and events like story hours, book groups and sing a longs. Also, take advantage of the free museum pass program. Just ask at the front desk.http://www.somervillepubliclibrary.org617 623 5000 Hours Sunday 1-5, Monday-Thursday 9-9, Friday 9-6, Sat 9-5 (hours posted are valid until June 16,2007). Summer hours may change Thursday 11-11:45 story time 3-5years Friday 11-11:30 – story time 2-3year Monday 11-11:30 baby lapsit. See the website for other services and events

properties.name: Stella Bella Toys
properties.description: Posted by Stevesinger1360 Cambridge Street, Cambridge MAGreat toy store with plenty of events for kids like sing a longs and play groups. http://www.stellabellatoys.com/ 617 491 6290 Inman Square store hours: Monday through Saturday 9:30 AM -7:00 PM. Sunday 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM. Alternate Location: Stellabella Toys in Porter Square, Cambridge. 1967 Mass Ave, right next to Bob Slate\'s. Porter Square hours Monday through Saturday 10:00 AM-6:00 PM. Sunday Noon-5:00 PM. 617.864.6290 Tuesday 10 am baby playgroup Tuesday 4pm toddler playgroup Thursday – Music Together (must sign up with Music together groovybabymusic.com and pay for these classes) p>Friday 10:30 New parents coffee Sat 11am – free sing along

properties.name: Walking Entrance to Davis Square
properties.description: Posted by StevesingerWhere Highland ends and Elm becomes Holland Street, Davis Square begins. Here you\'ll find the Somerville Theater where you can catch a movie or a show. Enjoy a scoop of J.P. Licks ice cream just across from the T. Stop in at one of the many bars in the area: The Burren, Joshua Tree, Orleans, or Johnny D\'s. There\'s plenty of food to choose from too: Indian (Diva), Barbecue (Red Bones), Mexican (Anna\'s Taqueria or Rudy\'s just up Holland Street in Teele Square), or Italian (Mike\'s). And of course you can grab some coffee at the Diesel Cafe or Starbucks. And in the summers, there\'s a farmer\'s market in the parking lot behind Starbucks.To get there from the condo just make a left out of the driveway and keep walking up Summer Street until you can\'t walk anymore. When you\'re greeted by Domino\'s pizza and the Rosebud Diner, you\'ve arrived. Keep walking straight and you\'ll pass the Burren and Mike\'s and arrive at the T shortly.

properties.name: Walking Entrance to Harvard Square
properties.description: Posted by StevesingerJust take Summer Street to School Street to Somerville Avenue. Make a right on Somerville Avenue and continue to the Brooks Pharmacy. Make a left at Brooks Pharmacy, cross over Beacon Street, and continue straight to Kirkland Street. Make a Right on Kirkland street and Harvard square is just steps away.

properties.name: Walking Entrance to Inman Square
properties.description: Posted by StevesingerCambridge Street and Prospect Street, the heart of Inman square, where you\'ll find some of the best food in the Cambridge/Somerville area. And it is just steps away from your condo. Eat great sandwiches at All Star Sandwich, try bbq at the East Coast Grill, or southern cuisine at Magnolia\'s. Or stop in at the famous S&S for a nice deli sandwich. The Druid is a fine Irish bar and check out Ryles if you like Jazz. There are also plenty of shops and boutiques to browse. And just around the corner on beacon street you\'ll find Rosie\'s Bakery and the Thirsty Scholar.

properties.name: Walking Entrance to Porter Square
properties.description: Posted by Stevesinger An easy walk to Porter Square, where you\'ll find Christopher\'s, Wok N Roll, Anna\'s Taqueria, Shaw\'s Market, and a nice little bar called Toad. And of course, the T. To get there from the condo, just take Laurel Street to Somerville avenue. Make a Right and continue straight on Somerville avenue until you arrive at the T stop.

properties.name: Walking Entrance to Union Square
properties.description: Posted by StevesingerFrom the condo, you\'re just a 1/2 a mile, a few minutes walk, from Union Square. There are restaurants like the Independent bistro and pub (with contemporary cuisine including braised pork and clam chowder in the bistro and poker nights, board games, music and a good place to get a Guinness in the pub). You\'ll also find Taqueria Mexicana (a fine, simple Mexican restaurant), Great Thai Chef (which some say is the best thai food in the Somerville/Cambridge area), and just around the corner on Somerville Avenue, across from Market Basket, Caesar\'s Pizza (the best pizza, subs, and standard italian you\'ll find. Keep in mind, they only take cash).

properties.name: Your Condo
properties.description: Posted by Stevesinger94 Summer Street, Somerville MAYour new home near Union square, Somerville is in the perfect central location; walking distance to Porter, Davis, Harvard, and Inman Squares and just a few miles from downtown Boston. You\'re close to shops, restaurants, parks, public transportation, and highways. And you get a front row seat to the exciting changes coming to Union Square: Green Line Stop, Deisel Cafe, and more.
